message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.CC

The paper deals with the problem of amplifying a small dataset to a larger one that appears to be drawn from the same distribution, even when learning the distribution accurately is impossible with the given small dataset. This problem is closely related to machine learning and statistics, and the paper provides results for both discrete and Gaussian distributions. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) since the paper deals with the problem of amplifying a small dataset. The paper also discusses the limitations of the results and suggests future research directions, which are related to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and computational complexity (cs.CC).
